content.description: Start to climbers right of the bolts.  TR anchor off tree or tree and bolts to get anchor in position.  Steady ledge climbing to the top
content.protection: fixed bolts at top, tree to anchor off and set the anchor to climbers right of bolts
content.location: to climbers left of crack to crack.  Follow path under overhang rock

content.description: Crux at the start on overhang but easier if you start left.    Holds may be slippery with plants/dirt.
content.protection: No pro. Top top of rock and tree at top
content.location: It's the Arete between There's Bolts Up There? & Crack to Crack

content.description: Named because the top of this leads to the cave for "Toe Jam"   Great warm up for the toprope routes, very good for beginners learning to climb with feet
content.location: to climbers left of the large toprope rock

content.description: Follow crack to a good undercling. Reach for 3 finger pocket and top out.
content.location: After the built stair case you will face the route.

content.description: Named for the blood streaks directly below the bolts... no clue how they got there
content.location: Left of "there's bolts up here?" All holds on "there's bolts up here?" are off to get full 5.8 experience.

content.description: crux is 2nd move to larger right flake   Start matched on small flake   Left hand to large flake   Big right hand to large flake on right of boulder...   Hug your way up to top out   Boulder to the left is off (everything left of crack on left is off)   Recently cleared as of 10-30-17
content.protection: pad, spotter   Don't recommend top out for beginners... fall from the top of this would not be good
content.location: climbers left of toprope routes and Into the cave. Follow path and boulder is on the right, should see a cleared area around boulder

content.description: Inside cave start on underclings in the back. Traverse left out of the cave and up over the boulder.
content.location: Down wooden stairs, follow trail right.

content.description: Below fire tower, a couple boulder problems and a trad/TR route.
